Name:
Diana
Margaree
Builder: Palmers Shipbuilding and Iron Company, Hebburn-on-Tyne
Motto:
Certo Dirigo ictu
("I aim with sure blow")
Fate:
Transferred to the Royal Canadian Navy on 6 September 1940
Sunk following collision, 22 October 1940
Badge: On a Field Blue, a crescent Moon Silver
Displacement:
1,375 long tons (1,397 t) (standard)
1,890 long tons (1,920 t) (deep)
Propulsion:
2 × shafts
2 × Parsons geared steam turbines
3 × Admiralty 3-drum boilers
Range: 5,870 nmi (10,870 km; 6,760 mi) at 15 knots (28 km/h; 17 mph)
Armament:
4 × QF 4.7-inch Mark IX guns
1 × 12-pounder (3 in (76.2 mm)) anti-aircraft (AA) gun
2 × 1 - QF 2-pounder Mk II AA guns
2 × 4 - 21 inch (533 mm) torpedo tubes
20 × depth charges, 1 rail and 2 throwers
